name: Mooding.me
tag_list: social-network, share, mood, network, social-community, moods, social
overview:
Mooding.me is an online real-time social networking and microblogging service launched in August 2012, owned and operated by Intellifusion Technologies Inc. Mooding.me enables its users to post how they feel at any point in time 24/7, and leave a brief 100-character comment about their chosen “mood”. Right now Mooding.me is available in English and Spanish.

Profile Page

Mooding.me users can create their profile with photos and sharing how they feel in that moment, after following the few simple tutorial steps. Users can express themselves using the “mood icons” and share their mood with every user, or restrict them to their followers. Users may subscribe and “Follow” others’ “moods” and check their latest mood updates and profile page.

“Moods” & Privacy Settings

Their interface provides numerous “moods” that are icons which users can choose to express what they are feeling at the moment (e.g. happy, sad, excited, hungry, worried, etc.). Mooding.me allows its users to choose their own privacy settings and choose to protect their “moods” or not. Moods can be seen by anyone by default; however users can choose the “protect my moods” option and limit them to only their followers to see. Users can post a mood from the Mooding.me website and the optimized mobile site for smartphones.

Timeline & Mentions

The platform includes a chronological display of all the mood updates done by the “Followings”. Unlike other social networking platforms Mooding.me has 4 different voting options for interaction; like, dislike, love and hate and a reply button. The mentions page shows all the votes that a mood has received chronologically and the moods where a user uses “@” to mention someone.

Reply & Private Messages

On every mood posted on the timeline, a user can “mood back” or reply with another mood. The user is able to choose whether if the reply is private or not. One month after its launching, Mooding.me has more than 250 users in 24 different countries, English and Spanish versions and other languages coming soon.
